chap10

Class Searching

  • java.lang.Object
    • chap10.Searching

  • public class Searching
extends java.lang.Object
    Demonstrates the linear search and binary search algorithms.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Lewis, Loftus

    • Method Detail

      • linearSearch

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> T linearSearch(T[] list,
                                                                 T target)
        Searches the specified array of objects for the target using a linear search. Returns a reference to the target object from the array if found, and null otherwise.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type placeholder for comparable type
        Parameters:
        list - Array to be searched
        target - Value to search for in array
        Returns:
        Target found from array, null if not found

      • binarySearch

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> T binarySearch(T[] list,
                                                                 T target)
        Searches the specified array of objects for the target using a binary search. Assumes the array is already sorted in ascending order when it is passed in. Returns a reference to the target object from the array if found, and null otherwise.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type placeholder for comparable type
        Parameters:
        list - Array to be searched
        target - Value to search for in array
        Returns:
        Target found from array, null if not found
